timeline.message: First implementation of GetOutages in DLMS adapter protocol
added GetOutagesResponse to possible result objects
removed power failure feature from FindEvents; added cucumber tests for GetOutages through bundle process

replies.bodyText:
I agree this makes the event converter a little less overloaded and simpler.
However, it comes at the expense of breaking the larger context, in which events have different properties, by setting the power outages apart from other events as some more special case. I think they are just one other example of an event and a cleaner solution would leave the overall idea of the event intact.
For instance, the communication session events have a counter, that none of the other events from the other event logs have.
The power failure events have a duration, and do not share an event code that events from the other logs have.
The only property all events have is some event timestamp (though the meaning of this timestamp is derived from the context of the event log).
replies.author: bvdzwet

timeline.bodyText: there is no validation code here? not needed ?
timeline.author: coendamen

replies.bodyText:
Sometimes (depending on the type a request) validation is not necessary.
In such cases a comment is needed to explain it is not simply forgotten (and to keep SonarQube quiet).
See for instance some other classes like GetConfigurationObjectRequestData.
replies.author: bvdzwet

replies.bodyText: There are no input parameters to validate
replies.author: jboon

replies.bodyText: I added a comment that there no need for validation and corrected the copyright.
replies.author: jboon

timeline.author: coendamen

replies.bodyText:
It wasn't the prettiest code, but I think it only highlighted already existing issues with handling the events that have subtle variations in the data they contain.
I wouldn't be to cheerful resolving it by only dealing with the power failure event log as outage, ignoring the conceptual overlap and differences between all event logs.
replies.author: bvdzwet

replies.bodyText: There is another story on the backlog that will make conditional logic inevitable. About the power failure log, this seemed to be a feature that was a whole different beast. We were mislead by the term event log, but ran into problems throughout the whole stack reminding us about this poor fit. Current implementation seems much better, simplifying things on all levels. But I'm sure we can still have a debate on the choices when picking different perspectives.
replies.author: jboon

timeline.bodyText: possible NPE here? can eventData.get(0) value be null itself ?
timeline.author: coendamen

replies.bodyText: For each item we get two values. They are essential to the data and are not expected to be a possible null-reference
replies.author: jboon

timeline.bodyText: could be removed or changed to debug ?
timeline.author: coendamen

timeline.bodyText: there can be more getOutageRequest at the same time? this seems strange, normally there is one request executed in the command executor
timeline.author: coendamen

replies.bodyText: good one, I'll have a look at this
replies.author: jboon

replies.bodyText: Probably an enthousiastic copy cat, it wasn't needed. Same List object detected in the FinfEvents flow, guess that inspired.
replies.author: jboon

timeline.bodyText: for my understanding, why is there a request list? and not a single request to get the outages from a meter?
timeline.author: coendamen

timeline.bodyText: Formatting is messed up, and if this is the only change, I wonder why this file is included in this pull request at all.
timeline.author: bvdzwet

timeline.bodyText:
Besides this change, that is tied to the decision between outages and power failure event logs, I noticed someone messed up the line endings of this file a year and four months ago.
Line endings should only be newlines, not Windows style carriage return plus newline.
timeline.author: bvdzwet

You could consider leaving it out.
